data.title: Fix aircraft husk crash velocity
data.body:
This fixes the long glide time aircraft husks had when they were shot down. They are falling down to earth much faster now and the distance covered matches that from release-20150614.

This has been a common complaint with the current release (e.g. [1](http://logs.openra.net/?year=2015&month=09&day=22#20:57:46), [2](http://logs.openra.net/?year=2015&month=09&day=25#00:00:32))

data.title: Crash when selecting a dead actor
data.body:
While playing a test game with a ridiculous amount of lag, I got the following exception:

```
Crystallized Doom Mod at Version 0.3 Closed Dev Beta - 2015-26-09
on map 82b1771f9fd562bb567ae0faa8f487ae1b142dc2 (River Raid by Westwood Studios).
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (gasol 1366 (not in world))
   at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.CheckDestroyed(Actor actor) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\TraitDictionary.cs:line 84
   at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.Get[T](Actor actor) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\TraitDictionary.cs:line 89
   at OpenRA.Actor.Trait[T]() in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Actor.cs:line 216
   at OpenRA.Widgets.WorldInteractionControllerWidget.<HandleKeyPress>b__11(Actor a) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Widgets\WorldInteractionControllerWidget.cs:line 246
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectEnumerableIterator`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Collections.Generic.HashSet`1.UnionWith(IEnumerable`1 other)
   at System.Collections.Generic.HashSet`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection, IEqualityComparer`1 comparer)
   at System.Collections.Generic.HashSet`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection)
   at OpenRA.Exts.ToHashSet[T](IEnumerable`1 source) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Exts.cs:line 341
   at OpenRA.Widgets.WorldInteractionControllerWidget.HandleKeyPress(KeyInput e) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Widgets\WorldInteractionControllerWidget.cs:line 244
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.HandleKeyPressOuter(KeyInput e) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Widgets\Widget.cs:line 377
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.HandleKeyPressOuter(KeyInput e) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Widgets\Widget.cs:line 373
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.HandleKeyPressOuter(KeyInput e) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Widgets\Widget.cs:line 373
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.HandleKeyPressOuter(KeyInput e) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Widgets\Widget.cs:line 373
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Ui.HandleKeyPress(KeyInput e) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Widgets\Widget.cs:line 116
   at OpenRA.DefaultInputHandler.<>c__DisplayClass1.<OnKeyInput>b__0() in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Input\InputHandler.cs:line 39
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T](World world, Func`1 fn) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Sync.cs:line 187
   at OpenRA.DefaultInputHandler.OnKeyInput(KeyInput input) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Input\InputHandler.cs:line 39
   at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.Sdl2Input.PumpInput(IInputHandler inputHandler) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Platforms.Default\Sdl2Input.cs:line 164
   at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.Sdl2GraphicsDevice.PumpInput(IInputHandler inputHandler) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Platforms.Default\Sdl2GraphicsDevice.cs:line 374
   at OpenRA.Renderer.EndFrame(IInputHandler inputHandler) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Renderer.cs:line 154
   at OpenRA.Game.RenderTick() in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 537
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop() in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 644
   at OpenRA.Game.Run() in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 662
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 117
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in d:\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 39
```

My guess is an actor died (crash occurred during a big battle) but due to the lag was not removed from the world in time and I was able to select it.

data.title: Refactor Missile projectile
data.body: Essentially the latest version of #8717, only without the last commit (the in-advance height-level check it adds is plagued by some issues, let's deal with that later) and rebased.

data.title: /devall command and Weapons Factory crash OpenRA in missions with oldlst (open hovercraft)

to reproduce: start "Storm the beachhead", enable /devall , build a Weapons Factory and select Vehicles tab.


data.title: TD: Lua replace GDI/Nod player reference variables with player/enemy
data.body:
as suggested in #9456
also fixes unit production in nod02a and nod02b (killed infantry wouldn't get rebuilt)

data.title: Add support for inter-mod dependencies
data.body:
Adds support for mods requiring specific versions of other mods in order to run.
The "engine version" will be represented by `modchooser`'s mod version, which will allow mods to target a specific engine version.
Closes  #8991.

The UI can be bikeshed at length, but I decided to open this now as the prerequisite was merged earlier today so the approach and underlying code can be discussed (to hopefully save some time).

Note: One thing left to be done is have the packaging scripts update the mods' required versions from `{DEV_VERSION}` to the release/playtest version. Help with that would be nice.

data.title: Fix a crash in the soviet04 missions
data.body:
As reported on the [forums](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=83&t=18733&start=0&postdays=0&postorder=asc&highlight=).

This crash occured if you killed the `Village` actors before triggering the `OnEnteredFootprint`.
Above case can be achieved by using planes.

data.title: D2K clock in replay viewer is gone in latest release
data.body: The clock from the previous release's (06-14) replay viewer is gone with the new (09-19).

data.title: Exposed pips to trait documentation and lint testing
data.body: This is a common source for errors. Makes a start at cleaning it up.

data.title: Change D2k power draw and various other aspects to match original
data.body: After #9453, #9458 and this there should be only some minor loose ends remaining (Palace infantry, tweaking debris etc.).

data.title: Change D2k shroud revealing ranges to match original
Fix NullReferenceException in HackyAI.BuildUnit
data.body: Reference #9222 and https://github.com/Phrohdoh/OpenRA/issues/15#issuecomment-141710307

data.title: Lua: standardize naming of player?
data.body:
Currently, for TD missions the player is either referenced as "GDI/Nod" or "player"
- `player = Player.GetPlayer("GDI")` (gdi01)
- `gdi = Player.GetPlayer("GDI")` (gdi04a)

should this be made consistent throughout all TD missions?

I'd prefer to always use "player/enemy" for factions for two reasons:
- makes code more readable
- makes code more reusable (copy&paste a function from a gdi to a nod mission without having to deal with gdi/nod mixups; also half the missions capitalize the player as "Nod", the other half as "nod")

this should reduces the chance for bugs (uppercase VS lowercase "GDI", and accidentally referencing the wrong player)
## <bountysource-plugin>

</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: In-game mod browser/installer
data.body:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9028 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9029 are good ideas, but they have bad discover-ability by the players. They need to already know that thirdparty mods exist, where to find them and that you can install those just like browser addons. This proposal may however not exclude the previous ideas of "manual" installations from URLs and in-game updating, but rather complete it.

Other Open Source game engine projects already solved this:

Inspiration:
- https://bananas.openttd.org
- https://springrts.com/wiki/Games

An in-game browser lists assets and mods available for download via the repository. That way you can discover a whole palette of mods you didn't know about. Downside is that this relies on a (yet non-existing) web-service. It may be in the scope of http://resource.openra.net though. Might also be the best way to ship mini mods ("mutators") https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9422.

With the rejection of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9396 I thought this further. If separating mods and engine completely is the preferred way, we probably need this badly so people don't first start the game and see "Choose your battlefield: no mods installed" and quit, uninstall, comment "doesn't work", because they forgot to click on an `openra-mod://mods.openra.net/ra-release-2042-10-23.zip` URL somewhere hidden in the news post.

We probably have to ship a blank engine with just a `modbrowser` mod. A benefit of not including any non-free content and downloading everything on first game start may be that this open the doors for inclusion in official Linux repositories if we ever want this especially in ones with long release cycles.

Synchronizing the releases of all currently supported mods together with the engine isn't a trivial matter though and probably will lead to some player base fragmentation. On the other hand, very actively developed mods don't have to wait for another release cycle to do balancing adjustments etc.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26981730-in-game-mod-browser-installer?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: TD Additional Balance Changes
data.body:
Additional fixes and ideas:

Infantry stealth detection: Increase sight range of stealth detection to
2 from 1.

MLRS: Reduce price to 900 from 1200

Repair pad: Power to 10 from 30.

Blue Tiberium: Reduce the value income to 75-90% from 110%

Infantry evade chance: 75 from 67

Samsites: cost reduced to 700 from 750

Airstrikes: Increase cool down timer to 3:30 from 3:00.

Forums location: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=17430&start=30

Might add a bit more (If I don't screw anything else up)

data.title: Change D2k Cost and CustomBuildValues to match original
data.body:
Additionally changed queue build speeds and set prerequisite for all starport units to just starport.

Another chunk from #9106.

data.title: Move FrozenActor creation to Created in FrozenUnderFog
data.body: Move `FrozenActor` creation from `FrozenUnderFog.Tick` to `FrozenUnderFog` constructor as discussed in #9262 after merge.

data.title: Re-design server browser and lobby
data.body:
I think the server browser (and to some extent the lobby) are in need of an overhaul. Here's a mockup I created fairly quickly with a few concepts highlighted. I'm not a self proclaimed design expert at all :), please chime in!

Server
- Show up to 10 servers at a time now with a flatter lobby list. Currently with the chat we only see 3!
- Show a panel on the right for more detailed information, we don't really care about some of this stuff for every single server (minimap preview, ip, version, and potentially players)
- Potentially allow players to sort by clicking on the server list columns
- Move the server filter into its own popup panel, which would show over the server list
- Change the chat to be tabbed - this means once you join a server, you can alternate between global and lobby chat

Lobby
- Added a Music button and moved the Change Map button. The Music panel would cover the player bin when opened.
- Changed the chat to be tabbed - let you switch between lobby and global chat.

Mockups (the OpenRA window is 1280x1024)
- It was suggested we keep the geometry of the server browser and game lobby the same size
- This has to fit the user interface's design limitation of 1024x768 size resolution

![serverbrowser](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/566742/10119065/8dd007e8-6448-11e5-8279-f255c61d3c95.png)
![lobby](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/566742/10119050/1ab872a4-6448-11e5-9dd2-706239636f42.png)

These mockups are available as a Balsamiq file so anyone can tweak them

data.body: Includes better error reporting.

data.title: Hide the OwnerRow of the "Oil Pump"s tooltip in campaign missions
Cache AttackGarrisoned fire ports using IRulesetLoaded
data.body: As a bonus `OpenRA.Utility.exe`_mod_`--check-yaml` (and by extension `make test`) will check for matching lengths.

data.title: D2k worms are too aggressive
data.body:
In the original, worms were neither as fast nor as aggressive. If I remember correctly, they also ignored actors on rock.

I think they should move slower, have a lower scan radius and ignore actors on rock.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26969025-d2k-worms-are-too-aggressive?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Provide an early exit in RunActivity when there is no activity
data.body: Provides a tiny speedup for actors that are idle, as we can avoid calling `Stopwatch.GetTimestamp()`.

data.title: Remove overridden ButtonBaseLine line in mods/modchooser/metrics.yaml
Spatially partition IEffects
data.body: We render every effect in the world, including those that are outside the screen bounds.  Adding a new `SpatiallyPartitioned<IEffect> partitionedEffects` to ScreenMap for use by the WorldRenderer should give us a reasonable rendering performance win.  As an added bonus this should cut the rendering workload to the point where it is feasible to interleave actor and effect renderables, which fixes a big chunk of polish issues.

data.title: Fixed AI bots trying to assign orders to units not in the world
data.body: The AI was ordering units around which are not in the world. This is futile and probably responsible for some performance regressions whenever units are airlifted in. Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9385.

data.title: Removed the included MOUSE.R8
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9263. The file is unmodified. It was just shipped, because we had to.

data.title: OpenRA crashes on launch
data.body:
OpenRA launches, but just gives me the spinning wheel. I have left it to spin for several minutes, but to no avail.

This is what I can find in the system logs after trying to launch it a few times:

2015-09-26 10:56:40,925 OpenRA[577]: Running launchgame with arguments:
2015-09-26 10:56:40,925 OpenRA[577]: --debug
2015-09-26 10:56:40,926 OpenRA[577]: /Applications/OpenRA.app/Contents/Resources/OpenRA.Game.exe
2015-09-26 10:56:41,002 OpenRA[577]: launchgame exited with code 131
2015-09-26 10:56:49,190 com.apple.xpc.launchd[1]: (com.apple.xpc.launchd.oneshot.0x10000006.OpenRA[577]) Service exited with abnormal code: 1
2015-09-26 10:59:45,088 OpenRA[938]: Running launchgame with arguments:
2015-09-26 10:59:45,089 OpenRA[938]: --debug
2015-09-26 10:59:45,089 OpenRA[938]: /Applications/OpenRA.app/Contents/Resources/OpenRA.Game.exe
2015-09-26 11:00:56,907 OpenRA[938]: launchgame exited with code 9
2015-09-26 11:01:00,038 com.apple.xpc.launchd[1]: (net.openra.launcher.62512[938]) Service exited with abnormal code: 1
2015-09-26 11:01:06,313 OpenRA[950]: Running launchgame with arguments:
2015-09-26 11:01:06,313 OpenRA[950]: --debug
2015-09-26 11:01:06,313 OpenRA[950]: /Applications/OpenRA.app/Contents/Resources/OpenRA.Game.exe
2015-09-26 11:01:38,997 OpenRA[950]: launchgame exited with code 9
2015-09-26 11:01:43,540 com.apple.xpc.launchd[1]: (net.openra.launcher.62512[950]) Service exited with abnormal code: 1
2015-09-26 11:05:24,995 OpenRA[413]: Running launchgame with arguments:
2015-09-26 11:05:24,995 OpenRA[413]: --debug
2015-09-26 11:05:24,996 OpenRA[413]: /Applications/OpenRA.app/Contents/Resources/OpenRA.Game.exe
2015-09-26 11:11:21,667 OpenRA[413]: launchgame exited with code 9
2015-09-26 11:11:25,542 com.apple.xpc.launchd[1]: (net.openra.launcher.62512[413]) Service exited with abnormal code: 1

The OpenRA logs found in ~/Library/Application Support/OpenRA/Logs are all 0 bytes in size.

I have the following versions:

Mac OS X: 10.10.5
OpenRA: release-20150919
Mono: 4.0.4 SR 4 (4.0.4.1)

---

I have installed the game on another Mac with the exact same versions and it works fine on that machine.
